{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about highly vascular tumors of the brain and spinal cord in adults. Upon reviewing the provided documents, I found that one of the characteristic features of these tumors is an increased capacity to transfer materials between the lumen and the parenchyma, which includes alterations such as fenestration, widened intercellular junctions, increase in pinocytotic vesicles, and infolding of the luminal surface. This suggests that the tumor is highly vascular with altered blood vessels.", "answer_choice": C}
